title: Trusting God Like David
description: A family devotion about courage and faith based on David and Goliath

content.opening: Dear God, thank You for bringing our family together. Help us learn about trusting You like David did. Amen.
content.bibleStudy: Read 1 Samuel 17:45-47 together. David told Goliath that he came in the name of the Lord, not with sword or spear.
content.keyTruth: God is bigger than any problem we face, just like He was bigger than Goliath.
content.application: When we face scary or difficult situations, we can remember that God is with us and will help us.

discussionQuestions: What are some 'giants' or big problems kids might face today?
How can we trust God when we're afraid?
What did David remember about God that gave him courage?

activities.name: Giant Problem, Big God
activities.description: Draw or write about a problem you're facing, then draw God's love surrounding it.

activities.name: Memory Verse Actions
activities.description: Learn 1 Samuel 17:47 with hand motions to help remember God's power.

prayerSuggestions: Thank God for always being bigger than our problems
Ask God to help us be brave like David
Pray for family members facing difficult situations

title: Jesus Our Good Shepherd
description: A gentle family devotion about Jesus' loving care for us

content.opening: Heavenly Father, thank You for loving our family. Help us understand how much You care for us. Amen.
content.bibleStudy: Read John 10:11-16 together. Talk about how a shepherd takes care of sheep.
content.keyTruth: Jesus loves us and takes care of us like a good shepherd takes care of his sheep.
content.application: We can trust Jesus to guide us, protect us, and provide for our needs every day.

discussionQuestions: How does a shepherd take care of sheep?
How does Jesus take care of us like a shepherd?
What does it mean that Jesus knows us by name?

activities.name: Sheep and Shepherd Game
activities.description: Play follow the leader, with parents as shepherds guiding children safely around the house.

activities.name: Thank You Jesus Book
activities.description: Make a small book drawing ways Jesus takes care of your family.

prayerSuggestions: Thank Jesus for being our Good Shepherd
Ask Jesus to help us follow Him
Thank God for our family and His love for us
